adrFormatAddress: 1428 York Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA

originalText.text:
Came here for breakfast first time here. I just moved here in manhattan and my apartment is near!

I asked the staff for recommendations. They gave me 2 different kind of bagels with salmon and scallion cream cheese. I love it!

text.text:

I asked the staff for recommendations. They gave me 2 different kind of bagels with salmon and scallion cream cheese. I love it!

originalText.text:
I recently had the pleasure of discovering a kosher bagel store that has exceeded my expectations in every possible way. As a food enthusiast, I'm thrilled to share my exceptional experience with others.

Atmosphere:
The moment you step into the store, you're greeted by a warm and inviting ambiance. The modern, well-lit interior creates a comfortable setting, perfect for a quick bite or a leisurely meal. The cleanliness is evident, and the friendly staff exudes a welcoming vibe, making you feel at ease.

Food:
The bagels are truly the stars of the show! Freshly baked, perfectly chewy, and bursting with flavor, they're a testament to the art of traditional bagel-making. From classic favorites to innovative creations, the variety of options is impressive.

Highlights:

1. The Everything Bagel: A masterclass in balanced flavors, with a delightful combination of poppy, sesame, and garlic.

2. Cinnamon Raisin Bagel: Sweet and savory, this bagel is a sweet treat, especially when topped with cream cheese.

3. Lox and Cream Cheese: A match made in heaven! Thinly sliced, smoked salmon paired with rich cream cheese elevates the classic bagel and lox experience.

4. Veggie Bagel Sandwich: A delightful vegetarian option, with crispy eggplant, zucchini, and bell peppers, all held together by a flavorful hummus spread.

Service:
The staff's dedication to customer satisfaction shines through. Orders are fulfilled promptly, and the team is happy to answer questions, offer recommendations, or accommodate special requests.

In conclusion, has secured a special place in my heart (and stomach!). I highly recommend this kosher bagel store to anyone seeking an exceptional culinary adventure. The outstanding food, welcoming atmosphere, and attentive service ensure that every

originalText.text: Much more than I expected! Had a delicious vegetarian cheeseburger! We also enjoyed the soup and yes the bagels.  Jeremy behind the counter was gracious and helpful. A wonderful experience for lunch with the family. A classic East side eatery with its own type of charm.  And great for orders and take out. Thanks for your smiles and service.

text.text: Much more than I expected! Had a delicious vegetarian cheeseburger! We also enjoyed the soup and yes the bagels.  Jeremy behind the counter was gracious and helpful. A wonderful experience for lunch with the family. A classic East side eatery with its own type of charm.  And great for orders and take out. Thanks for your smiles and service.

originalText.text: Absolutely disgusting!!! Ordered an egg white on plain bagel and received a regular egg on a plain bagel with cheese. I was at the ER with a family member so I decided to eat it anyway but when I bit into it I discovered a hair in it! Called Bagels and Co. and they promised to send a replacement which arrived over an hour later even though I was only 8 blocks away! Spoke to 2 different people on the phone who were both very rude and neither offered an apology. Horribly miserable experience!!!

originalText.text: Solid bagel place but if you’re looking for a really good bagel there are better places. The prices are standard and a bagel with cream cheese is about $4.65. The staff is nice and the place is clean. The bagels are good and the smears are the same.
